definitions.definition: Reliance on the truth of something said or done; faith; trust.

definitions.example: He arrived five minutes late, but to his credit he did work an extra ten minutes at the end of his shift.

definitions.definition: Acknowledgement of a contribution, especially in the performing arts.
definitions.example: She received a singing credit in last year's operetta.

definitions.definition: (television/film, usually in the plural) Written titles and other information about the TV program or movie shown at the beginning and/or end of the TV program or movie.
definitions.example: They kissed, and then the credits rolled.

definitions.definition: A privilege of delayed payment extended to a buyer or borrower on the seller's or lender's belief that what is given will be repaid.
definitions.example: In view of your payment record, we are happy to extend further credit to you.

definitions.definition: The time given for payment for something sold on trust.
definitions.example: a long credit or a short credit

definitions.definition: A person's credit rating or creditworthiness, as represented by their history of borrowing and repayment (or non payment).
definitions.example: What do you mean my credit is no good?

definitions.definition: An addition to certain accounts; the side of an account on which payments received are entered.
(tax accounting) A reduction in taxes owed, or a refund for excess taxes paid.
definitions.example: Didn't you know that the IRS will refund any excess payroll taxes that you paid if you use the 45(B) general business credit?

definitions.definition: A source of value, distinction or honour.
definitions.example: That engineer is a credit to the team.

definitions.definition: An arbitrary unit of value, used in many token economies.
definitions.example: To repair your star cruiser will cost 100,000 credits.

definitions.definition: Recognition for having taken a course (class).
definitions.example: If you do not come to class, you will not get credit for the class, regardless of how well you do on the final.

definitions.definition: A course credit, a credit hour – used as measure if enough courses have been taken for graduation.
definitions.example: Dude, I just need 3 more credits to graduate – I can take socio-linguistics of Swahili if I want.

definitions.definition: To believe; to put credence in.
definitions.example: Someone said there were over 100,000 people there, but I can't credit that.
Credit accounts receivable with the amount of the invoice.
Credit the point guard with another assist.

definitions.definition: To bring honour or repute upon; to do credit to; to raise the estimation of.
